event: nonspecific small bowel gas on plain radiograph
diffuse small bowel wall thickening on ultrasound
rushed to pediatric emergency department again
fluid and medications infused through intraosseous cannulation
central venous catheter placement via left subclavian vein
large amount of ascites on CT
poor or absent enhancement of strangulated bowel segment on CT
three quarters of small bowel herniated through mesenteric defect
mesenteric defect near ileocecal valve (two fingerbreadth size)
congenital internal hernia with strangulated small bowel diagnosis
resection of gangrenous small bowel (>2 meters)
anastomosis of proximal jejunum and terminal ileum
four-day treatment in pediatric intensive care unit
started soft diet on 5th day post-operation
hypertension due to renal ischemic injury
